a little intermezzo - if you haven't noticed already, i changed the typeface for my blog entries!

why the change?

in short, i wanted the "tone" of my published writing to match that of my drafts.

i started experimenting with monospace type for writing in notion and obsidian some time ago, and the difference was night and day. perhaps this is due to the more "polished" appearance of sans serif type­faces, but allowing my personal thoughts to flow onto the page felt... much harder, for some reason. and while i quite like instrument sans - which is the typeface that i used before (and still use for the rest of my website) - my thinking just didn't read back as naturally to me.

entry.title: bye neocities (part 2)
entry.content:
update - a very funny thing happened last night right after i posted my blog yesterday:

now, being on three different web hosts just feels excessive, so the new plan is to set up a splash page with a redirect on ichi and neocities! will get around to that in the near future.


i‚Äôve been meaning to talk more about this unwelcome change once i have properly settled into my new web host, so here‚Äôs an updated recap of my recent departure from neocities. full disclosure - nearly a week has passed since both the website and its associated profile was taken down, and i still don‚Äôt know why. i‚Äôve already contacted support, but i‚Äôve yet to receive a response. (oddly enough, i can still receive password reset emails, but none of the links go through.)

all that aside‚Ä¶ i‚Äôve since forked out some cash to reupload my website (again) to a more established hosting service under a new domain, but i don‚Äôt plan on leaving ichi.city behind.

i miss connecting with people via neocities‚Äô discovery feed, and i genuinely enjoyed the social aspect of the service - sometimes, it feels a bit lonely existing within an isolated pocket of my own. i liked being able to share what i‚Äôve made for myself without persistently promoting myself on other social media platforms or ‚Äúimproving my SEO‚Äù, and i don‚Äôt feel like venturing very far outside of the smaller, cozier communities that already exist within the indie web.

so with that said, i‚Äôll continue mirroring ‚Äújasmine‚Äôs journal‚Äù to https://jasm1nii.ichi.city/ for as long as i‚Äôm able to, or at least until i hit the upper limit of my allotted storage space (10 megabytes, to be exact). for reference, this website takes up a grand total of around 4 MB on my hard drive, but it will likely explode in size once i get my illustration gallery up. while i have more than enough room to accommodate for these planned additions on my paid hosting service, i can‚Äôt guarantee that i‚Äôll reupload everything to ichi, but i‚Äôll try to work around the limit by using fallback links or uploading my images to dropbox instead.

and now a message from our sponsors* ‚ù£

*i am sharing this link out of my own free will, and nobody is paying me anything.

wanna store your files on a service that isn‚Äôt google drive? dropbox‚Äôs free tier starts off at 2 GB, but you can get 500 MB extra storage space if you use my referral link and download dropbox for desktop.

p.s. - i've enabled webmentions, by the way! at the moment, my brain isn't big enough for understanding how to fetch and display them automatically, but that's probably for the best. i'll stick with manually adding reposts to prevent spam. for now, have a comment box - please be kind!

entry.title: bye neocities
entry.content:
hi, ichi.city!

this website is a carbon copy of what used to be hosted on neocities. my site was taken down without warning, and i can't log into my profile there.

therefore, there's probably a lot of broken links and out-of-context writing that's specific to neocities. i'll fix stuff eventually on my own time.

for now, please abstain from linking to my old URL at https://jasm1nii.neocities.org/ until further notice - you can link to this one, instead.

entry.title: parroting a broken record held together by elmer's glue
entry.content:
(context if you don't know what elmer's glue is)

the staple of every USian classroom, only good for cruddy papier-m√¢ch√©, and nothing more:

i'm no stranger to writing long posts‚Ñ¢ on the internet - and yet, spelling out my thoughts sans parsing via instagram stories and tweets remains a daunting task. i feel ridiculous for not being able to drop my social anxiety in a space supposedly curated for me and me only, but you know what they say about old habits.

maybe with time, i might see that change.

why posting my thoughts on private accounts doesn't cut it for me (1 paragraph)

in short: i don't really know who to include in those circles anymore, and keeping all of this to myself in my actual journal feels... inadequate. none of the previous channels i've tried were cathartic enough for my autistic social needs - spacehey is a close contender, though. i'm doing this all on a whim, crossing my fingers that i'll connect with the right people by putting stuff wherever i'm more likely to find them.

-

anyways, i'm not sure what to say in this post that hasn't already been said an uncountable number of times across the indie web (very much past the point of becoming a tired cliche). i just hope that i'll be able to make the most out of what i've already crafted - knowing how much effort i've put forth up until this point, it would be a waste not to.
